achieve. My ideology is based on what will be best in the long run, not

seem to think he was just a misogynist. His hatred was against everyone.

punish them for experiencing the pleasure he had been denied. Something 
intellectually and culturally inferior. His narcissism is quite apparent as

of entitlement was not limited to sex, but rather encompassed anything and 
everything which he desired. Money, respect, popularity, you name it he

outlines this.

As to how and why he developed this way I think the manifesto gives us that 
as well. He outlines pretty much his life story and it is striking how 
utterly devoid it was of interpersonal relationships. His parents had built 
their lives around their careers leaving them little time to spend with him 
as a child and when he sought the bonding he was not getting from his 
parents from his peers they rejected him and picked on him for being small 
and weak. He was left to develop his world view in utter isolation with no 
external input since he was an infant. Thusly what he came up with was an 
infantile self made ideology in which he believed sex should be outlawed 
and irradicated. That if he couldn't have it he would destroy it so no one 
else could like a toddler breaking a toy so they wouldn't have to share. In 
truth he was very much an emotionally stunted infant in a young man's body, 
and his rampage was the inevitable tantrum that ensued. He was his own echo 
chamber enabling him to create his own extremist ideology and then to spur 
himself on to act upon the ideology he created for himself.

his psychosis.﻿

This guy really should have sought help before immediately resorting to 
suicide. Why he didn't seek help is unknown, but maybe after he had done so 
he would have been completely changed. I felt his pain though, because 
there are people that are in the position he was in, but what he did was a 
permanent solution to a temporary problem, and he should have examined all 
of his options first before taking his own life. Deep down, maybe he was a 
nice guy, but just couldn't take the pain anymore. 

If I knew him, unless he harmed me or has a worse personality than what was 
caused by his depression, I would have definitely become his friend and 
tried to support him with his problems. 

To me this is a very sad story. I hate when people do this, they should 
look at what they DO have, and try to get as much therapy as possible, just 
open up, reach out to someone, like an adult or parent, about what they are 
feeling. ﻿
